Topic.Title: Main Window
Topic.s:
Here's a short description of the program's user interface and how to use the program.

 

The Application's Main Window

Here you can see a screen shot of the application's main window.

 

Basically, the windows consists of four parts:

    • The menu and tool bar area which allows you to control saving, opening and resetting a file as well as executing an algorithm.
    • The status bar which shows you the current mouse position on the drawing are.
      (This is useful to set exact polygon points.)
    • The drawing area where you can draw polygons and see the algorithm results.
    • The sub-windows around the drawing area which are:
      • The polygon list which shows your polygons so far in a tree view style to see which polygon's are contain in others and furthermore gives you the possibility to delete polygons via it's context menu.
      • The toolbox which allows you to control the drawing area's settings like what to draw and how to draw it.
      • The log window which is used to display warnings when drawing a polygon (e.g. intersections) as well as algorithm output

 

Menus and Toolbars

The menu is more or less identical to a typical Windows application and should not need further explanation.

The toolbars, one the one provide quick access to some of the menu function, on the other hand control the program's drawing and algorithm functionality in the following way:

    • The Control tool bar gives you the possibility to start the triangulation process in either (green arrow buttons from left to right)full speed, slow motion or single step mode. The next two buttons (play and pause) control the forward stepping or pausing of the algorithm in single step or slow motion mode. Whereas the last button (stop) ends the triangulation mode.

      Not that while running an algorithm, you cannot enter drawing mode to draw new polygons. Stop algorithm mode (by hitting the stop button) to enable the Drawing tool bar.

    • The Drawing tool bar is used to enter or exit polygon drawing mode. While in drawing mode, you can draw polygons but you cannot run an algorithm. End the drawing mode to enable the algorithm Control tool bar.

    • The View tool bar (just like the View menu) allows you to show / hide (from left to right) the polygon list, the low window and the toolbox window.

    • Last but not least, the Standard tool bar provides a shortcut to exit the program.
